trans-unit.source: The ServiceReferenceCollection object contains a <xref:System.Web.UI.ServiceReference> object for each Web service that is registered in an AJAX-enabled ASP.NET page.
Web services can be defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control or in an associated <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManagerProxy> control.

You can add Web services to the ServiceReferenceCollection object declaratively by adding one or more `<asp:ServiceReference>` elements to a `<Services>` element inside the `<asp:ScriptManager>` element on the page, as shown in the following example.

``` <asp:ScriptManager ID="SM1" runat="server"> <Services> <asp:ServiceReference Path="Service1.asmx" /> <asp:ServiceReference Path="Service2.asmx" /> </Services> </asp:ScriptManager> ``` You can also programmatically add a <xref:System.Web.UI.ServiceReference> object to the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager.Services%2A> collection by using the <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection%601.Add%2A> method of the ServiceReferenceCollection class.
Web services are registered with the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> control during the page's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender> life cycle stage.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ServiceReferenceCollection"></xref> class.
